meanings.sent1: After the chaos, they decided to reregulate the traffic.
meanings.sent2: The government plans to reregulate the industry to ensure fair competition.
meanings.sent3: The town council had to reregulate the parking rules after the mix-up.
meanings.sent4: She reregulated her study schedule to improve her grades.
meanings.sent5: The teacher had to reregulate the classroom seating arrangement for better focus.

meanings.sent1: The reregulations of the safety standards were necessary for public well-being.
meanings.sent2: There were new reregulations put in place to monitor financial transactions.
meanings.sent3: The reregulations on pet ownership caused quite a stir in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The company faced challenges due to the sudden reregulations in the market.
meanings.sent5: The reregulations in the school cafeteria led to healthier food choices.
